title: Ransomware Awareness Seminar | Singapore Institute of Technology

meta.description: The recent outbreak of WannaCry affected more than 200,000 individuals in over 150 countries, including Singapore.

text_lines: Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
Browse Professional Exams and Preparatory Courses
The recent outbreak of WannaCry affected more than 200,000 individuals in over 150 countries, including Singapore.
Attendees at SIT’s Ransomware Awareness Seminar
In partnership with the Association of Information Security Professionals (AISP), SIT

held the half-day Ransomware Awareness Seminar on 8 June 2017, at SIT@Dover, Auditorium, featuring guest speakers from Cyber Security Agency of Singapore (CSA), RSA Security, MWR InfoSecurity as well as faculty from SIT.

The audience of just over 160 who attended the seminar heard from industry experts who provided analysis on the evaluation and behavioural patterns of the ransomware as well as ways to protect ourselves against future malware attacks. A mix of Government-Linked Companies (GLCs), Multi-National Corporations (MNCs), Institutes of Higher Learning (IHLs) and Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) participated in the seminar, with SMEs providing the largest turnout.
Questions posted by seminar attendees for the panel session

In an engaging panel session that lasted for more than 45 minutes, our panelists fielded many insightful questions from the audience about the possible risks of WannaCry ransomware from an organisational and personal perspective. The Ransomware Awareness seminar provided the opportunity for the audience to gather first-hand insights on how to overcome the ransomware attacks in their respective sectors.
Panel Session (left to right): Mr Tok Yee Ching, MWR InfoSecurity; Dr Vivek Balachandran, Lecturer, SIT; Mr Yum Shoen Yih, Deputy Director, CSA;
Associate Professor Steven Wong, Programme Director, SIT & President, AISP; Mr Kong Chong Ming, Technology Consultant, RSA; Mr Ho Hee Meng, Senior Lecturer, SIT.
This seminar was organised as part of SIT’s lifelong learning initiatives in helping the Singapore workforce to stay relevant and agile in changing times.
SIT students showcasing the actual WannaCry ransomware infections to seminar attendees
This article was originally published on

SITLEARN is the lifelong learning division of Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), Singapore's first University of Applied Learning. We focus on providing lifelong learning opportunities for working adults to upgrade their skills and knowledge for the workplace.
Information Security Risk Management and Audit

Specialised micro-credential for strong technical and theoretical expertise in information systems audit, security management, and risk management based on Agile. Earn a Specialist Certificate and stack it towards a degree in Applied Computing.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Information Security, Cybersecurity, Risk Management, Audit, Competency-based Education
This specialised micro-credential imparts cloud computing skills, covering architecture, big data analytics, and security.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
Cloud Computing, Cybersecurity, Computer Architecture, Competency-based Education
Workshop on the Fundamentals of IoT Forensics
Learn IoT forensics to extract firmware from devices and prevent critical, life-threatening malware attacks in a 2-day workshop.
AI and Machine Learning, Cybersecurity, Internet of Things
This specialised micro-credential covers key areas in information security, cryptography fundamentals, security analytics and real-world applications.
Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Computing (via the CSM Pathway)
This 3-day workshop helps cybersecurity professionals understand national-level cyber strategies and legal governance in combatting cyber threats.
SIT Partners MINDEF to Offer Cyber NSF Scheme

Minister for Education (Higher Education and Skills) and Second Minister for Defence Ong Ye Kung officiated at the signing of a work-learn Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the Ministry of Defence (MINDEF)’s Defence Cyber Organisation (DCO) and the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT) on 12 February 2018. The MOU was signed by Defence Cyber Chief Mr David Koh and Professor Loh Han Tong, Deputy President (Academic) and Provost, SIT.

Exciting news! We are introducing new micro-credentials in Electrical and Electronic Engineering & Infrastructure and Systems Engineering. Be among the first to know by registering your interest today!
SIT reserves the right to make changes to published course information, including dates, times, venues, fees and instructors without prior notice.
Singapore Institute of Technology. All Rights Reserved.
